etymologies: Old English scearu ‘division, part into which something may be divided’, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch schare and German Schar ‘troop, multitude’, also to shear. The verb dates from the late 16th century

definitions: a part or portion of a larger amount which is divided among a number of people, or to which a number of people contribute

examples.text: under the proposals, investors would pay a greater share of the annual fees required
we gave them all the chance to have a share in the profits

shortDefinitions: part or portion of larger amount which is divided

definitions: part proprietorship of property held by joint owners

examples.text: Jake had a share in a large, seagoing vessel

shortDefinitions: each of notional parts into which property held by joint owners is divided

definitions: the allotted or due amount of something that a person expects to have or to do, or that is expected to be accepted or done by them

examples.text: she's done more than her fair share of globe-trotting

shortDefinitions: amount of something that person expects to have

definitions: one of the equal parts into which a company's capital is divided, entitling the holder to a proportion of the profits

examples.text: they bought 33 shares of American Standard

shortDefinitions: one of equal parts into which company's capital is divided

definitions: an instance of posting or reposting something on a social media website or application

examples.text: there have been 25,000 shares on Twitter and 117 likes on Facebook as of 7:30 p.m.

shortDefinitions: instance of posting information on social media site

definitions: have a portion of (something) with another or others

examples.text: he shared the pie with her
all members of the band equally share the band's profits

shortDefinitions: have portion of something with another or others

definitions: give a portion of (something) to another or others

examples.text: money raised will be shared between the two charities

shortDefinitions: give portion of something to another or others

definitions: use, occupy, or enjoy (something) jointly with another or others

examples.text: they once shared a house in the Hamptons
there weren't enough plates so we had to share

shortDefinitions: use, occupy, or enjoy something jointly with another or others

definitions: possess (a view or quality) in common with others

examples.text: other countries don't share our reluctance to eat goat meat

shortDefinitions: possess view or quality in common with others

definitions: (of a number of people or organizations) have a part in (something, especially an activity)

examples.text: the companies would share in the development of three oil platforms

definitions: tell someone about (something, especially something personal)

examples.text: she had never shared the secret with anyone before

definitions: post or repost (something) on a social media website or application

examples.text: the app lets you share your photos on Facebook, Twitter, and Tumblr
